text:
A Model Group (<all>, <choice>, <sequence>) constraint at:

http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-1/#cos-element-consistent

requires that any 2 <element> declarations with the same namespace and name 
appearing at any level in a model group must have the same GLOBAL type 
definition. Here is an example that violates this constraint and no errors are 
reported by the parser.

3_8si36.xsd
===========
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<schema xmlns             ="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
        xmlns:si          ="http://www.Test.org/3_8si"
        targetNamespace   ="http://www.Test.org/3_8si">

<complexType name="badType">
  <sequence>
    <element name="elem1" type="string"/>
    <element name="elem1" type="string"/>
  </sequence>
</complexType>

<element name="root" type="string"/>

</schema>

3_8si36.xml
===========
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<si:root xmlns:xsi         ="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xmlns:si          ="http://www.Test.org/3_8si"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.Test.org/3_8si
                             3_8si36.xsd">
</si:root>
creator: mhuffman@ca.ibm.com

text:
I believe this is actually a valid test as the types for elem1 are the same 
named type, and the type does have a namespace.
creator: lmartin@ca.ibm.com
